intro: [WRONG START] Obernna csereii, commonly known as the Hungarian bellflower, is a perennial herb native to Central Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Oberna csereii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and wildflower landscapes.
